page.title: 20Toppesfield Pump
page.content: The village pump, which stands in the centre of the carriageway at the main road junction in Toppesfield, is an attractive local feature. There are actually two pumps and the larger one was still in use as the main source of water supply in Toppesfield as late as 1952 when mains water was installed. The well beneath the pumps was filled daily with water pumped from a spring in the valley south of Church Farm. Just as the pump was a traditional meeting place in earlier times when people gathered to draw water each day so it is still a focal point where young people congregate and older people wait for the occasional bus which passes through the village. The pump was roofed earlier this century and a bench seat was recently provided alongside it.
